bibl.title: Letter from Sidney Coe Howard to John J. Moran, January 12, 1932

div1.p: Howard requests an interview with Moran.

div1.head: Letter from Sidney Coe Howard to John J. Moran, January 12, 1932

opener.dateline:
157 EAST 82ND STREET
NEW YORK CITY
January 12th, 1932.

div1.p:
On December 22nd last I wrote letters to you and
to John R. Kissinger to ask you both if you would be willing to talk
to me about the parts you played in Walter Reed's yellow fever
experiments in Havana in 1900. At the time I hoped to get away for
a holiday about the 10th of this month and thought that, if you were
willing to see me, I should go to Havana.

I have since seen Kissinger but I have not heard from you. I am
writing you again, not so much to press you to see me if you are
unwilling to talk as to put my point of view more clearly before you.
I can well understand a man's not wanting to talk about himself to
reporters. I am not quite a reporter, however, (though I used to be
one) and, with the job I have in hand, I had much rather come as near as possible
to what actually happened and to what the real characters were actually
like than make up both characters and incidents for myself out of
whole cloth. Both Kissinger and Colonel Truby helped me a great deal,
but I feel that you, if you can see your way to it, can help me more than
either.

I shall not leave New York for a couple of weeks. Then I am
figuring on a postponed holiday in Mexico. If you will be good enough
to drop me a line at this address it will help me to set my plans. I
can, of course, go ahead and complete my job on my own. If there is a
chance of seeing you, however, I should go to Mexico by boat and via
Havana expressly to talk with you. I take this job very seriously.

I don't like to talk about myself any more, I gather, than you do.
If, however, you will look up my record in Who's Who you may feel that
this job will be decently done and that seeing me will not, in that sense,
be an entire waste of time. I shall look forward to hearing from you.
div1.closer:
Very Sincerely Yours, Sidney Howard. John J. Moran Esqre.,
Sunoco Gas Co.,
Avenida Menocal 102A,
Havana, Cuba.
